files.patch: @@ -101,1 +101,1 @@ - * The first is used to load foreign libraries, as well as to lookup symbols inside said libraries; the latter + * The former is used to load foreign libraries, as well as to lookup symbols inside said libraries; the latter @@ -103,2 +103,2 @@ - * so that clients can perform foreign function calls directly in Java, with no need to introduce intermediate - * layers of native code (as it's the case with the Java Native Interface (JNI)). + * so that clients can perform foreign function calls directly in Java, without the need for intermediate layers of native + * code (as it's the case with the Java Native Interface (JNI)).
